byline.contributor: Scott Reyburn contributed reporting from London.

abstract: Britain’s referendum vote to leave European Union rattles auction houses preparing for contemporary art sales in London, with many questioning country's ability to weather devaluation of pound and rocky market; art world experts contend instability will pass and assert investments in art have historically proven to be safe.

headline.print_headline: Brexit Vote Casts Uncertainty on the Fate of Britain’s Art Market
headline.main: Brexit Casts Uncertainty on Art Market

snippet: It is predicted that fewer pieces will come to market in Britain because of the weakened pound, but experts maintain that art will persevere as an asset class.
lead_paragraph: It is predicted that fewer pieces will come to market in Britain because of the weakened pound, but experts maintain that art will persevere as an asset class.
